result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

BTC: Bond will not be modified today. Def to provide copies of complaints to court.  Status conference scheduled for March 26, 2018 at 08:30 am.  Status conference scheduled for May 25, 2018 at 10:00 am.  Status conference scheduled for June 12, 2018 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Anthony D McGinnis in court, in custody.  Chris D Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Jane Slaght.
Matter is set over.  Status conference scheduled for February 26, 2018 at 08:30 am.

***ALSO $5,000.00 SIGNATURE BOND WITH CHARLES LONG***
 Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random UAs and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program. You must report to room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403) within 24 business hours (hours Mon-Fri 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. There will be status checks every two weeks to monitor.   Defendant to be placed on house arrest with GPS monitoring by Racine County Alternatives Program.  You must report to room MC340, in the Law Enforcement Center, 717 Wisconsin Ave, Racine WI  53403 (located at the top of the stairwell to the felony courts, just to the left of the elevator).  NOTE: A $120 advance fee for installment of the GPS must be paid prior to the release from jail.   Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
Status conference on February 13, 2018 at 09:30 am.

Bond forfeiture notice -
     Order forfeiting bail and notice of application for judgment. $750.00 cash bond; deft missed 01/19/2016 hearing

Attorney Sally A Hoelzel in court.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Ms. Hoelzel has no more information than what she has last week in terms of documentary information but she spoke to deft's girlfriend last Friday indicating that documentation was needed regarding hospitalization. The State asks that the stay on the warrant be lifted

BTC: BW/BF

Attorney Sally A Hoelzel in court.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Defense has provided documentation that deft is in the hospital 1-8 to 1-10 and she was notified this morning that he was re-admitted to the hospital last night but may be released later this evening. The Court does not construe the second document a valid excuse for defendant not to be here today. 

BTC: The Court stays the warrant until 1/18. Defense to get further documentation for the Court  Status conference scheduled for January 19, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Sally A Hoelzel in court.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Ms. Hoelzel indicates that deft's girlfriend called her and indicated that defendant is in the hospital. She asked for verification from the hospital but has not received it as of yet. The State indicates deft has missed numerous court dates and that the Court issue BW/BF. If deft is in the hospital, the State has no objection to having the warrant stayed.

BTC: BW/BF - STAYED until 01-14-2016  Status conference scheduled for January 14, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Sally A Hoelzel in court.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Defense indicates that deft was not present on the last court date. Defense received communication from her office that the deft had a stroke this morning. The State asks for STC 30-45 days out to get info as to whether deft can proceed or not

BTC: Set STC in 45 days  Status conference scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Sally A Hoelzel in court.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Marilyn Leedle.
